guide.title: Gentoo Linux Installer Frequently Asked Questions
guide.abstract: This FAQ attempts to answer all of the questions (even the stupid ones) that people ask over and over.

li.uri: I'm installing Gentoo (not using the installer) and I have a problem...
Will the installer run from the 2005.1 minimal/universal CD?
When will the installer be done?
Does/will the installer support architecture X?
Why can't I create a ReiserFS filesystem with the installer?
Why doesn't the installer do such and such?

Will the gentoo installer configure my such and such hardware for me?

What's wrong with the current installation method?

section.title: I'm installing Gentoo (not using the installer) and I have a problem...

body.p: What does this have to do with the installer? Oh, that's right, nothing. Go to #gentoo or bugs.gentoo.org.

section.title: Will the installer run from the 2005.1 minimal/universal CD?

body.p: No. At the minimum, the installer requires parted, pyparted, and pythondialog which are not on the official release CDs.
No, it will be done when it's done.

section.title: When will the installer be done?

body.p: Yes, but it's only at version 0.1 and still has many bugs. You can obtain an experimental ISO with X and the installer at /experimental/x86/livecd/x86/ on your favorite mirror. The file is called livecd-x86-2005.1, however the name is subject to change.

section.title: Does/will the installer support architecture X?

body.p: The first release of the installer is only planned to support x86 and amd64. There are plans to support sparc, hppa, and ppc in the future.

section.title: Why can't I create a ReiserFS filesystem with the installer?

body.p: Because reiserfs == teh suck...and libparted doesn't support it very well.

If you are using true hardware RAID, the installer will see the array as a normal drive (because the kernel sees it this way too). As for LVM and fake RAID/md, the installer does not currently support them but it will in the future.

section.title: Why doesn't the installer do such and such?

body.p: It's an alpha for crying out loud.

section.title: I like the manual install. Why are you forcing me to use a graphical installer?

body.p: The current install method will always be an option. The installer will be distributed on a true LiveCD that contains xorg, Gnome, fluxbox, mozilla, and other goodies. There will still be a minimal LiveCD that has just enough stuff to boot and install by hand.

section.title: Gentoo is too hard to install and I feel like whining.
Will the gentoo installer configure my such and such hardware for me?

body.p: No. The installer will only do what is covered in the install guide.

section.title: Where can I find more information about the installer?

body.p: On the project pages. Currently, there is no documentation. You can either read the source or ask in #gentoo-installer. If you ask any questions covered by this FAQ, you will most likely be ignored.

section.title: What's wrong with the current installation method?

body.p: Absolutely nothing. The goal of the installer is to make installations faster, not easier. The original intention was to make an installer for doing automated deployments. While we still have this in mind, the end user aspect took precedence (mainly because it's prettier).

section.title: What language is the installer written in?
Does the installer have localization support?

body.p: Some basic code for localization of the frontends has been written, but it has not been integrated yet.

At the current time, we need testers. If you are good with python, take a look at the various TODO lists in the latest CVS snapshot. Otherwise, we'll accept good bug reports (/tmp/installprofile.xml and /var/log/install*log included from failures). In the near future, we will also need people to write documentation.

section.title: How can I get voice in #gentoo-installer?

body.p: Asking a question covered in this FAQ will get you kicked and possibly banned from the channel. If you are trying to use the installer without first having successfully completed an install using the existing method, go away. At this point, we are looking for bug testers. We only want meaningful bug reports, and it's hard to get to those through the flood of "what is a stage tarball URI?" and similar questions. We also do not care that you think the installer is stupid, will ruin Gentoo, etc. Once you have read through this FAQ, just join the channel and '/msg gibot voiceme' to get voice.
